Pre-Game Insights: Bahrain causing shockwaves on the Gold Coast with a 1-0 victory in Australia has shaken this six-nation group up, Australia now without success in two games.
Bahrain have suffered just the two defeats in their last nine matches in all competitions, both to Japan.
Indonesia have only experienced one defeat in their most recent encounters in all competitions, coming to Iraq in June.
Indonesia have responded with draws against the likes of Saudi Arabia and Australia in this group, keeping a clean sheet in the latter.
Shin must decide whether to tinker with his Bahrain XI, considering the 5-0 defeat to Japan.
Indonesia may go with an unaltered lineup despite the 5-0 defeat, while Bahrain's lineup remains unchanged.
FC Twente defender Mees Hilgers could be drafted into the defence for his debut given his experience in the Eredivisie.
